discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
The correct answers are:

 Active Directory External Identity Sources
 Library Condition for External Identity: External Groups

To achieve the goal of configuring Active Directory to then use information from Active Directory in an authorization policy, the following components must be configured:

 Active Directory External Identity Sources: This component allows Cisco ISE to authenticate users against an Active Directory domain.
 Library Condition for External Identity: External Groups: This component allows Cisco ISE to use groups from an external identity source, such as Active Directory, to make authorization decisions.

The other options are incorrect

Selected Answer: CE
C & E are components in addition to AD group import

Selected Answer: CE
We don't need to set ID source sequence because the question only asks for AD for authorization. So it should be the AD External ID Source and Library Condition.

comments.content: Tricky question but you are right, the identity source sequence is configured on the authentication phase, not in the authorization , imho the only CORRECT 100% answer is E

discussion.content: Surely C and E? You don't need to configure an identity store sequence to use AD

questions.question_text:
An engineer deploys Cisco ISE and must configure Active Directory to then use information from Active Directory in an authorization policy.
Which two components must be configured, in addition to Active Directory groups, to achieve this goal? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Library Condition for External Identity: External Groups
choices.D: Library Condition for Identity Group: User Identity Group

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D-- no brainer; more than one node needed for failover hence distributed mode deployment

questions.question_text: Which deployment mode allows for one or more policy service nodes to be used for session failover?

discussion.content:
Using the Cisco ISE Guest Sponsor Portal, the receptionist, who is a member of the Guest Service sponsor group, can typically perform the following guest services:

C. Create and manage guest user accounts.

This means the receptionist can create new guest user accounts and manage their details through the Cisco ISE Guest Sponsor Portal. The other options (A, B, D) are typically not part of the responsibilities of a guest sponsor in this context. Keep in mind that specific permissions may vary based on the exact configuration and role assignments in your Cisco ISE deployment.

Selected Answer: B
B--provided the sponsor group gets those permissions!

Selected Answer: B
It should be B
B.. tested and deployed in live environment.

CORRECT B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-1/sponsor_guide/b_spons_SponsorPortalUserGuide_21/Support_Guests.html

questions.question_text:
A network administrator has just added a front desk receptionist account to the Cisco ISE Guest Service sponsor group.
Using the Cisco ISE Guest Sponsor Portal, which guest services can the receptionist provide?

choices.C: Configure authorization settings for guest users.
choices.A: Keep track of guest user activities.
choices.D: Authenticate guest users to Cisco ISE.
choices.B: Create and manage guest user accounts.

choices.A: by embedding the security group tag in the 802.1Q header
choices.D: by embedding the security group tag in the IP header
choices.C: by enabling 802.1AE on every network device
choices.B: by the Security Group Tag Exchange Protocol

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B makes since.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct-- Security Group Tag Exchange Protocol (SXP) is used to form peer relationships and exchange CTS environment data (SGT mapping, Policy, etc.) in lieu of direct Trustsec client relationship of ISE capability or a contiguous SGACL domain. Also used to bridge continuous SGACL Domain over non-SGACL devices such as other vendor devices. Also use with devices such as Cisco central WLC as it uses the Airespace OS and not IOS.

questions.question_text: What is a method for transporting security group tags throughout the network?

discussion.content:
correct is B
cause Webauth is mandatory

Selected Answer: C
The answer should C Captive Portal Bypass as requirement.

Selected Answer: D
Endpoint already profiled in ISE: This is not required, but it can help to improve the user experience. If the endpoint has already been profiled in ISE, then it will be able to connect to the network more quickly and easily.
 WEBAUTH ACL for redirection: This is required. The WEBAUTH ACL is used to redirect guests to the web portal where they can enter their credentials.
 Captive Portal Bypass turned on: This is not required. Captive Portal Bypass allows certain devices, such as printers and VoIP phones, to bypass the captive portal. If you do not need to use Captive Portal Bypass, then you can leave it turned off.
 valid user account in Active Directory: This is required. As mentioned above, this is the most important requirement, as it allows you to authenticate guests against your Active Directory domain.

comments.content:
The word Guest refers to the users that are not part of your organisation,, you can not have them on AD. Either you auto enrol them or use codes and temp usernames for access.

In this context the ACL will be needed to redirect them to the self registration portal

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
WebAuth allows users access to the network after a successful authentication via a captive HTTP or HTTPS portal.
